page.title: 18Onley Sewage Works,Rugby
page.content: This Sewage works was built to serve Onley Prison and its estate.A local farm is also linked to it. The prison was built in an isolated area and too far from the nearest town to use the main sewers. Sewage is lifted by pump to the first collecting tank. Gravity does all the work of moving sewage from one tank to another.Small flies breed in the filter beds and encourage certain bacteria which purify the water. No chemicals are added to the sewage. After leaving the filter beds the water is 75% pure. Before being discharged into a stream,the water is passed via a tank into a well. Three people maintain the plant-a Works and two prisoners. To prevent flooding the pump-room grill is cleaned every day. The plant serves about 1000 people.
